paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the TTR gene variant Val30Met in the context of TTR-FAP, providing penetrance data and patient demographics.

patients.phenotype: TTR-FAP, with 52.3% asymptomatic carriers and 47.7% symptomatic patients

individual_records.evidence_sentence: At diagnosis (we have data for 65 subjects), there were 34 (52.3%) asymptomatic carriers and 31 (47.7%) symptomatic patients.
At diagnosis (we have data for 65 subjects), there were 34 (52.3%) asymptomatic carriers and 31 (47.7%) symptomatic patients.

functional_data.summary: The Val30Met mutation is the most common variant associated with TTR-FAP.

variants.segregation_data: Yes, it segregates with disease in families.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on clinical presentation and family history.
variants.additional_notes: All subjects had the Val30Met mutation.
key_quotes: The most typical presentation of TTR-FAP is a progressive nerve length-dependent, sensory-motor polyneuropathy.
Liver transplantation provides a useful and specific therapy for TTR-FAP by allowing for the suppression of the main source of the mutant TTR.

extraction_metadata.notes: Data was extracted from the main text, with a focus on the TTR gene and its associated variant.
